meanings.definition: To turn or flip over quickly.
meanings.sent1: I saw a squirrel flype from one branch to another.
meanings.sent2: The gymnast will flype in the air during her routine.
meanings.sent3: The pancake decided to flype in the pan all by itself!
meanings.sent4: Her heart seemed to flype with joy when she saw the surprise.
meanings.sent5: The magician made the card flype out of the deck with a flick of his wrist.

meanings.definition: A quick, sudden movement or flip.
meanings.sent1: The cat's flype off the table startled everyone in the room.
meanings.sent2: The acrobat's flype was so graceful and impressive.
meanings.sent3: The flype of the coin into the fountain made a wish come true.
meanings.sent4: The flype of the pages in the wind created a fluttering sound.
meanings.sent5: The flype of the fish out of the water was a sight to behold.

meanings.sent1: She had to flype her decision at the last minute.
meanings.sent2: The weather can flype from sunny to stormy in an instant.
meanings.sent3: The mood of the room seemed to flype as soon as she entered.
meanings.sent4: The colors of the sunset flype into a beautiful blend of hues.
meanings.sent5: The situation can flype from calm to chaotic in a blink of an eye.
